We had an inside atrium room that was beautiful
would select this hotel again as I travel for business very nice meeting site
One block from Fountain Square downtown a gathering place hosting free concerts other cultural events as well as a seasonal ice rink
Our room had large fixed windows that overlooked the huge atrium like area above the lobby directly above the bar lounge area
The atrium is a lovely space
Keep up with your steps with the vintage marble and walnut staircase

1: So my husband and I stayed for three nights for a conference at a nearby hotel
I understand hotels need to be renovated but I think they should tell you that before you book especially in a grand hotel like this where the Atrium is so much part of the experience
We got one of the larger king rooms with a small terrace facing the interior atrium
2: Hotel staff could not explain satisfactorily their purpose andor function
The old time feel was not longer there other than the beautiful staircase that remained
The new lobby is very noise particularly if you have a room overlooking the interior atrium
I have not seen staircases like this in decades
Around 2 am to my relief that noise died down but then the open atrium scene below kicked into laugh scream mode
My room was cooled by a floor unit vented through an interior window looking out over the open atrium lobby
This hotel is old unremarkably renovated and even the premium rooms have no windows but an opening to an atrium
The atrium is generally quiet but any noise that does occur affects every room that is on it
On top of this the room did not have a functioning thermostat and there was no heat with very cold outdoor temperatures
